meanings.definition: A spot or stain, especially of ink or paint.
meanings.sent1: The ink left a blot on the paper.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally spilled paint, creating a blot on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The blot on his shirt made it look like a colorful design.
meanings.sent4: The blot of ink on the document seemed to symbolize a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The blot on the wall stood out like a tiny, dark island in a sea of white.

meanings.definition: To remove or obliterate something unwanted.
meanings.sent1: He used a tissue to blot the spilled juice from the table.
meanings.sent2: She carefully blotted out the mistake in her notebook.
meanings.sent3: The magician blotted away the image, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to blot out the memories of that painful day.
meanings.sent5: The eraser worked like magic to blot away the pencil marks.

meanings.definition: To soak up or absorb liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sponge can blot up the spilled water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel was used to blot the excess oil from the pizza.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty plant seemed to blot up all the water in the vase.
meanings.sent4: The desert sand seemed to blot up the raindrops in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The towel was so absorbent, it could blot up a whole glass of spilled milk.
